meanings.definition: To be stingy or frugal in spending or using something.
meanings.sent1: She always skimps on buying new clothes to save money.
meanings.sent2: He skimps on groceries by buying only the cheapest items.
meanings.sent3: The millionaire skimps on tipping at restaurants, much to the dismay of the waitstaff.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity skimps on details, focusing more on the overall picture.
meanings.sent5: The company skimps on employee benefits, leading to low morale among workers.

meanings.definition: To do something hastily or carelessly in order to save time or money.
meanings.sent1: He skimps on cleaning his room by quickly stuffing everything in the closet.
meanings.sent2: She skimps on studying for exams, resulting in lower grades.
meanings.sent3: The chef skimps on measuring ingredients, often leading to disastrous dishes.
meanings.sent4: His speech skimps on preparation, causing him to stumble over his words.
meanings.sent5: The contractor skimps on materials, resulting in a poorly constructed building.
